title: Cancer Care in Lebanon
userBackground: You are a recent graduate from the Yale School of Public Health. You work as a Program Coordinator for End Cancer Now, a global health NGO headquartered in NYC. End Cancer Now has been invited by the Lebanese Ministry of Public Health (MOPH) to help develop an intervention to address the breast cancer burden among Syrian and Iraqi refugee women in Lebanese refugee camps. End Cancer Now has international recognition, wide ranging infrastructure and capacity, extensive funding, and a sizable labor force of physicians, humanitarian workers, epidemiologists, and more.
